description.narrative: The Project will lead to sizeable energy savings, GHG emissions reductions, green job creation and poverty reduction. It focuses on creating a favourable market environment and a scalable business model for investment in energy efficiency retrofits.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1.1. Level of development and coverage of Monitoring, Reporting and Verification (MRV) system and database. 1.2. Availability and implementation of a plan for sharing lessons learned. Number of project website users. Number of women's group involved. 2.1. Availability of the UNDP’s framework to support policy-makers in selecting public instruments to promote energy efficiency investment. 2.2. Availability of binding legislation on building codes. 2.3. Availability of adequate secondary legislation – providing a clear and effective set of functional models and a standard set of rules for multi-owner building management bodies to undertake energy efficiency retrofits. 2.4. Availability of business models for repayment of energy efficiency investments. 2.5. Availability of additional exit strategy measures. 3.1. Availability of banks to develop and market products for energy efficiency retrofits in individual houses. Level of men and women professionals trained on appraising investments and developing energy efficiency projects. 3.2. Availability of banks to develop and market products for energy efficiency retrofits in multi-owner residential buildings. 3.3. Level of capacity of local government to develop energy efficiency retrofit projects for public buildings. 3.4. Availability of amount and number of loans for building renovation provided. 3.5. Creation of marketing materials and platform. 4.1. Availability of financial mechanism to provide targeted financial incentives. Number of female-headed households who received funding. Number of beneficiaries (disaggregated by sex and age) in the female-headed households. Number of public buildings that receive a financial incentive in order to make the energy efficiency retrofit NPV positive (following restrictions and eligibility criteria in Operational Manual)

comment.narrative: 1.1. No Monitoring, Reporting and Verification (MRV) systems for the buildings sector in Armenia established. 1.2. No knowledge management and MRV information disseminated. 2.1. Framework not used for energy efficiency in Armenia. 2.2. Policies proposed and consultation ongoing. 2.3. Secondary legislation lacking. 2.4. No business models for repayment of energy efficiency investments in buildings in place. 2.5. No exit strategy measures implemented 3.1. Banks do not have the capacity to develop and market products for energy efficiency retrofits in individual houses. 3.2. Banks do not have the capacity to develop and market products for energy efficiency retrofits in multi-owner residential buildings. 3.3. Local government does not have the capacity to develop energy efficiency retrofit projects for publicly-owned buildings. 3.4. No lending provided. 3.5. No marketing materials exist. 4.1. No incentives in place.

1.1. Implementation of MRV component is transferred to the EPIU. 1.2. (1) Awareness raising outdoor campaign implemented, covering Yerevan and marzes. (2) www.mershenq.am platform established and operational. A tool introduced for collecting age and sex-disaggregated data on project website users and visitors. (3) 2 women groups involved in support to the pilot projects. 2.1. 1 public instrument identified. 2.2. (1) Support provided to UDC on further improvement of MAB operation and maintenance rules and building passport formats and (2) needs assessment to select the codes/standards elaborated ensuring compliance to the international commitments. 2.3. Further assistance provided to the Government regarding draft law On Multi-Apartment Buildings Management” 2.4. (1) Support provided to municipalities on setting up a resource center for information provision on starting/managing a HoAs. Training manual on management and maintenance of residential buildings agreed. (2) Legal framework for cooperation with R2E2 defined. 2.5. Design of additional exit strategy developed. 3.1. (1) Operational Manual for GCF financial support mechanism for individual households re-designed and approved by the GCF. (2) Technical assistance provided to partner banks/Financial institutions to implement financial support mechanism. (3) At least 20% of trainees are women professionals. 3.2. Operational Manual for GCF financial support mechanism for MAB retrofits redesigned and approved. 3.3. (1) Technical assistance provided to the EIB/E5P funded Yerevan EE Project, in particular the Energy Audits for 18 kindergartens conducted and submitted to Yerevan Municipality and EIB. (2) Full renovation (accessibility and EE) design documentation for 26+3 kindergartens developed and agreed with Yerevan Municipality/PIU. Independent review for EE retrofit designs for 26 and new design of 3 kindergartens implemented. 3.4. (1) US $13.5 mln loan implementation ongoing. (2) Financial and economic analysis of investment in EE retrofits for 3 pilot buildings conducted. Sustainable business model for large-scale investment in EE retrofit in MABs designed. 3.5. Large scale marketing campaign on EE benefits conducted. Marketing materials developed and disseminated on MAB retrofit. Social media platforms maintained and updated regularly. 4.1. Conditions created for unlocking the Component 4 and launch incentive payment management cycle using procedures detailed in Operational Manuals for MABs in Yerevan, Outside of Yerevan (Subvention program) and Single-family houses.

1.1. Delayed: legal framework of MRV component implementation transfer negotiated with EPIU, however pending, due to changes of its management (3 times) in 2020. SoI on MEMS agreed with Yerevan Municipality. 1.2. (1) Done (2) Ongoing. (3) Ongoing: 2 women groups identified. 2.1. Done 2.2. (1) Delayed: results are in progress by UDC and depends on Government. (2) Done 2.3. Done 2.4. (1) Delayed: draft manual on setting up a resource center for information provision on starting/managing a HoA developed and consulted. (2) Done. 2.5. Done 3.1. Done 3.2. Done 3.3. (1) Done (2) Partially delayed: full renovation of design documentation and independent review conducted for 26 kindergartens. 3.4. (1) Ongoing: US $13.5 mln loan implementation ongoing. (2) Done 3.5. Done 4.1. Done: Project component 4 is unlocked and co-financing provided to residential buildings in regions (Subvention programme).

1.1. Requirements defined and conditions created to support EPIU for implementation of MRV component. 1.2. Awareness raising plan applied, including training events organized. 2.1. 1 public instrument identified. 2.2. Support provided to the UDC: Building passport format developed and agreed with UDC. 2.3. Recommendations provided to Government regarding draft law On Multi-Apartment Buildings Management . Support provided to the UDC: Building operation and maintenance rules developed and agreed. 2.4. Support provided to Yerevan Municipality on setting up a resource center for information provision on starting/managing a homeowners association (HoA). Training manual on management and maintenance of residential buildings developed. Draft training manual on management and maintenance of residential buildings developed. 2.5. N/A for 2019 3.1. Analysis of existing green/energy efficiency (EE) financial products for households undertaken. Consultations with local banks/International Financial Institutions conducted to identify barriers for EE financing for individual households. Financial products and structuring financing for implementation of EE retrofit projects for households developed. 3.2. Need assessment conducted for capacity building of banks. Ad-hoc technical assistance provided to partners, based on the signed SoI among KfW, National Mortgage Company and UNDP. 3.3 Technical assistance provided to the EIB/E5P funded Yerevan EE project related to the deep renovation designs for 30-50 kindergartens (exact number depends on Yerevan Municipality). 3.4. US $13.5 mln loan implementation ongoing. Cooperation and financing commitment reached for additional 2 public buildings. 3.5. Marketing materials developed and disseminated on public buildings’ refurbishment. Social media platforms updated. 4.1. N/A for 2019

1.1.Ongoing: conditions created by the Project for transfer of MRV component implementation to the EPIU; Requirements for the data collection on buildings in municipal level developed jointly with International Experts. Municipal Energy Management System (MEMS) is being piloted in the selected community (Stepanavan); SoI on applying MEMS is negotiated with Yerevan Municipality; Capacity building of local professionals conducted via Study Tour to Serbia and EMIS training. 1.2. Done 2.1. Done 2.2. Done. Technical assistance framework discussed with UDC, working group meeting conducted. 2.3. Done. 2.4. (1) Ongoing: Negotiations held with Yerevan Community on setting up a resource center for information provision on starting/managing a HOA. (2) Done 2.5. N/A for 2019 3.1. Done 3.2. Done 3.3 (1) Done. (2) Ongoing: design documentation packages with measures of EE for kindergartens developed. 3.4. (1) Ongoing: Loan is committed by the Yerevan Municipality. Conditions are created by the Project in the form of technical assistance for loan implementation. (2) Done 3.5. Done 4.1. N/A for 2019

1.1. (1) Implementation of Project Component 1 is transferred to EPIU, planned activities are set forth in the Letter of Agreement signed between UNDP and EPIU. (2) Energy Manager’s position created in Yerevan Municipality and Stepanavan Community. 1.2. (1) 5,000 number of beneficiaries reached with access to knowledge about energy use in buildings, opportunities and financing for EE. (2) Interactive Map of the project website is continuously populated with newly energy efficient retrofitted buildings data (3) At least 2 women groups are engaged in support to the pilot projects. 2.1. Analysis of public tools choice conducted. 2.2. (1) Supported provided to UDC on adaptation of international standards. (2) Assistance to the MoTAI in developing a package of legislative amendments to address inconsistencies in legislation on building EE certification and energy auditing. (3) Ongoing assistance to the MoTAI and communities involved in the State Subvention Program in an early preparation of the work plan for projects / applications. 2.3. (1) The adoption of legislative documents on building passport format and MABs building operation and maintenance rules by the Government is supported by UNDP. (2) Support to UDC provided on full adoption of law On Multi-Apartment Buildings Management . (3) Professional training organized for state inspection / auditing bodies and staffs of licensed organizations engaged in project expertise to ensure high quality standards of EE projects 2.4. (1) Assistance provided to communities in establishing community-targeted funds for ongoing operation / maintenance of EE-retrofitted MABs. (2) Training manual/material on management and operation of MABs developed and disseminated. (3) Conditions created for establishing maintenance funds for EE retrofitted MABs. 2.5. Exit strategy designed. 3.1. (1) Partner banks / financial institutions (NMC, KfW, ADB, ArmSwissbank) were provided with technical support for introduction of a financial assistance mechanism. (2) 20% of women professionals trained on appraising investments and developing EE projects. 3.2. Development of co-financing mechanisms supported for MABs EE retrofits in cooperation with local self-government bodies and other specialized structures. 3.3. (1) Communities will be continuously provided with technical assistance for EE retrofit projects for public buildings as per approved Operational Manual. (2) Survey will be conducted for revealing percentage of local government employees in Armenia who believe they have the capacity to develop EE retrofit projects for publicly-owned buildings 3.4. USD 14 mln EIB/E5P loan ongoing. New lending opportunities form International financial institutions identified and negotiated for building retrofits. 3.5. (1) Large-scale marketing campaign on EE benefits conducted. Marketing materials created and disseminated to at least 10,000 stakeholders. (2) Social media platforms maintained and updated regularly. Cooperation on marketing support discussed with partner banks. 4.1. (1) Around 30% female-headed households received funding. (2) Sex and age disaggregated data in female-headed households collected and reported. Financial incentives provided to implement EE retrofits in around 30 public buildings and 50 residential buildings receiving

1.1. (1) EPIU implements the activities as per schedule with (2) Energy Manager contracted by UNDP and approved by the Yerevan Municipality. 1.2. (1)1,000 beneficiaries reached (2) interactive map was populated (3) N/A for Q1, 2022 2.1. Recruitment initiated of a company for conducting analysis. 2.2. (1) 2 International Standards identified and consulted with UDC for adaptation. (2) Consultations to MoTA provided by UNDP experts (3) Ongoing assistance provided to communities. 2.3. N/A for Q1, 2022 2.4. N/A for Q1, 2022 2.5. N/A for Q1, 2022 3.1. N/A for Q1, 2022 3.2. N/A for Q1, 2022 3.3. N/A for Q1, 2022 3.4. In progress 3.5. N/A for Q1, 2022 4.1. N/A for Q1, 2022

1.1. Implementation of MRV component is transferred to the EPIU. SoI on implementation of Energy Management with Yerevan Municipality signed. 1.2. Awareness raising plan updated and implemented. Special tool added to the website for collecting age/sex-disaggregated data on visitors. At least 2 women groups are engaged in support to the pilot projects. 2.1. 3rd public instrument - Database of EE retrofitted buildings, finalized by UNDP and shared with the Government. 2.2. The Building passport format and MABs building operation and maintenance rules by the Government is supported by UNDP. Adaptation of two ISO standards is supported by UNDP. 2.3. Adoption of laws On Multi-Apartment Buildings Management and “On Condominium” is supported by UNDP. 2.4. Business models for repayment of EE investments in MABs implemented as set in Operational Manual. Establishment of Resource Centers in communities supported by UNDP. 2.5. N/A for 2021. 3.1. 2 local banks are supported in development of market products for EE retrofits in individual houses as per approved Operational Manual. 20% of women professionals trained on appraising investments and developing EE projects. 3.2. 2 local banks supported in development of market products for EE retrofits in residential buildings as per approved Operational Manual. 3.3. Local government and regional communities will be continuously provided with technical assistance for EE retrofit projects for public buildings as per approved Operational Manual. 3.4. USD 14 mln EIB/E5P loan ongoing. New lending opportunities form International financial institutions identified and negotiated for building retrofits. 3.5. Marketing materials created as per Communication Strategy and disseminated to at least 10,000 stakeholders. 4.1. Around 30% female-headed households benefited from the Project. Around 1,200 beneficiaries (disaggregated by sex and age) in the female-headed households. Up to 10 public buildings receiving financial incentive to implement EE retrofit.

2021 1.1. Component 1 of the project is officially transferred to EPIU for continuing implementation based on signed Letter of Agreement. MRV system and website are developed and Database of retrofitted buildings developed is continuously populated. Interactive Map of the buildings was added to Project’s web platform. More than 400 visits, including 69% man, 31% women. 1.2. Awareness raising plan for 2021 is prepared. Special tool added to the website for collecting age/sex-disaggregated data on visitors. At least 2 women groups are engaged in support to the pilot projects. 2.1. In progress. 2.2. The Building passport format and MABs building operation and maintenance rules by the Government is continuously supported by UNDP. Two ISO standards procured and translation into Armenian is initiated. 2.3. Adoption of laws On Multi-Apartment Buildings Management and “On Condominium” is supported by UNDP. 2.4. In progress. 2.5. N/A for 2021. 3.1. In progress. 3.2. In progress. 3.3. Local government and regional communities will be continuously provided with technical assistance for EE retrofit projects for public buildings as per approved Operational Manual. 3.4. USD 14 mln EIB/E5P loan ongoing. New lending opportunities form International financial institutions identified and negotiated for building retrofits (ADB. NEFCO). 3.5. Marketing materials created/updated as per Communication Strategy. 4.1. In progress.
